Interface IItem

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractItem, AlarmClock, Cake, Food, FreezeSpell, Hammer, Potion, Sandwich, Spanner, Spell, TeleportationSpell, Tool
public interface IItem
The interface for all items in the game. Every item in the game implements this interface, allowing players to interact with them in the game context.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    String
    getDescription()
    Provides a description of the item, giving details about its purpose or characteristics.
    String
    getDisplayName()
    Returns the display name of the item, which is shown to the player.
    IEffect
    getEffect()
    Retrieves the effect associated with the item.
    String
    getName()
    Gets the internal name of the item.
    boolean
    isConsumable()
    Indicates whether the item is consumable.
    void
    use(GameContext gameContext)
    Executes the use of the item in the given game context.

  • Method Details

    • use

      void use(GameContext gameContext)
      Executes the use of the item in the given game context.
      Parameters:
      gameContext - The current game context where the item is being used.

    • getEffect

      IEffect getEffect()
      Retrieves the effect associated with the item.
      Returns:
      The effect of the item, as defined by the IEffect implementation.

    • isConsumable

      boolean isConsumable()
      Indicates whether the item is consumable. Consumable items are removed from the player's inventory after use.
      Returns:
      true if the item is consumable, false otherwise.

    • getName

      String getName()
      Gets the internal name of the item. This is typically a unique identifier for the item.
      Returns:
      The internal name of the item.

    • getDescription

      String getDescription()
      Provides a description of the item, giving details about its purpose or characteristics.
      Returns:
      The description of the item.

    • getDisplayName

      String getDisplayName()
      Returns the display name of the item, which is shown to the player. This name is typically less technical than the internal name. **Not used particularly utilized in current iteration, feature for future**
      Returns:
      The display name of the item.
